titleStmt.title: Declaration of property Eighth consulate of Diocletian and seventh consulate of Maximian (303)
titleStmt.author: Aurelios Petearbeschinis, (Priest of Panopolis, Egypt)

msContents.summary: Declaration of property from Panopolis (modern name: Akhmim), Egypt, written on papyrus. Written by Aurelius Petearbeschinis son of Horos and priest of Panopolis to Aurelius Markos and Aurelius Zoilos, surveyors of the Panopolite Nome, listing holdings in the Panopolite Nome in accordance with an imperial edict. Dated to the eighth consulate of Diocletian and the seventh consulate of Maximian (AD 303). Part of the archive of Ammon, the well-known scholastikos, or lawyer

msItemStruct.note: Dimensions of fragments are 12.2 x 73.5 cm. or smaller
Written along the fibers on the recto
Upper margin of 1.5 cm.; left margin of 3 cm.; right margin of 1 cm
P.Duk.inv. 182 R (d) was formerly P.Duk.inv. G 182 (b)

supportDesc.support: 1 item : papyrus, reconstructed from numerous fragments, mounted in one of three glass frames, bottom is broken off

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
